review_list:
I was literally craving a sandwich while at Modernism Week, and thankfully found The Sandwich Spot! Crunchy fresh bread, no skimping on the fresh ingredients. It killed my expectations with delicious sandwichness.

This busy little sandwich shop makes some great sandwiches. There is only one vegetarian sandwich on the menu, but you can also build your own. And the vegetarian one was really delicious! My friends also really enjoyed their (large) sandwiches!
There is a small parking lot in front.

We found this by accident, and were very glad that we did. The menu consists of signature sandwiches, as well as, make your own. The woman at the counter was so nice and friendly. I ordered a turkey and cranberry sandwich on sourdough bread, and it was very large and delicious. I could only eat half of it.

We had the one with pastrami/sauerkraut and the triple decker with bacon, both on Dutch bread (the bread was the best part, unusual, crunchy on the outside). They close early, at 6 PM, we went at 5 and it was empty so we were served rapidly. Would go back.

From the reviews on Trip Advisor, I expected something more than a basic sub shop. Unfortunately, there is nothing special here - think Quizno's or Subway with very limited seating. The sandwiches are subs with the usual selection of meat and toppings plus the option of a "secret sauce" - an Italian-style salad dressing. Salads are made from iceberg lettuce...

This is a must stop while in Palm Springs if you're looking for a tasty lunch. We went there Thursday after reading the reviews and then went back Friday and again Sunday. So good! Heading there for a second visit today! We are only here for a week and so glad we found this place.
Husband and I shared a sandwich and it was enough for the two of us.

The Sandwich Spot's sammies are a cut above. Totally worth $8.95 for a giant and very tasty sandwich. One sandwich was both lunch and dinner for me. Try the Dutch Crunch bread.

I don't believe they could pile any more quality meat along with great toppings and keep the sandwiches together. We split one and it was plenty for a lunch portion. Sourdough bun was perfect as well. Add very cordial folks behind the counter it makes this definitely a great place to patronize.

A fire had destroyed a great eatery. We hope it will be rebuilt. This was a historic Palm Springs hang out for the Hollywood crowd of the past.

Finally getting around to my Dec reviews, and very sorry to hear that Bernie's had a fire the week after we were there. We had a great dinner there / and hope that Bernie's will make a comeback soon.

Bernie's Supper Club is by far one of the BEST restaurants in the area. Unfortunately they had a fire Christmas day and are closed until further notice. We wish the owners and staff our condolances and look forward to their reopening soon.

The ambience, the service and quality of the food. A fantastic experience for the price. Not a fantastically extensive menu but a good selection of meat, fish and pasta.

Bernie's burned to the ground in an early morning Christmas day fire. Given Palm Springs' less than business-friendly environment, let's not expect Bernie's to re-open anytime soon.

Very accommodating staff from the FOH to the BOH. The live entertainment was a nice touch, and wasn't too loud on the evening we went (a Sunday). We could tell it was definitely a spot for the locals, and that says something right there. Will definitely be back next time we're in the area.

review_list:
My wife and I were there on a Saturday for dinner. All the downtown restaurants that we were considering had long waiting lines. We remembered this place from a sample menu in our rental condo, and decided to give it a try.
No waiting, good service, great food.
The total $ for three entries plus drinks was $40.00.

We're in a vacation rental for several weeks and were delighted to find this Thai restaurant nearby that delivers! The food was traditional Thai, arrived hot and was delicious! Pad Thai, Pad SeEwe along with the garden veggie rolls were great choices for us.

Interesting, friendly and low-key place to eat. The Thai spicy basil eggplant was amazing! Prices were very good and service was prompt and friendly. It was an easy walk from our hotel on Mel.

We had heard America did not "do" Thai...this was fabulous. There were a few strange dishes but the Tom Yum was delicious as was the Panang Curry! We highly recommend it!!

My family was looking for a nice combination of choices for Thai food and we found it here. Tofu and vegetables were excellent and full of rich flavor. We ordered take out to enjoy the meal in our resort and were very pleased with how quick and pleasurable it was to order and eat in a short wait period.

Husband and I came to Palms Springs for a long weekend. We were looking for a casual low key place and found this great place. The service was great and the food equally as good. My duck curry was wonderful.

We wanted good, warm, flavorful food that we and the kids could be happy with. Everything was good. There were no desserts though. Just starchy plantains and coconut ice cream.

Great lunch specials, fresh food cooked to order, outstanding curries and great satay. A must visit. Try the yellow curry it is wonderful. Great lunch specials.

If you want delicious and authentic food, this is the place to be. Nice sized portions, made at the spice level you desire.

Really good Thai at a reasonable price. Extensive menu. Coconut milk soup was very good. Apps and main dishes also very good. I had spring rolls and tofu yellow curry. My favorite. A little warm on the day we were there possibly because it was an unexpected warm day in April.

This was the very first place I am when I came for dinner down to Palm Springs. OMG the food and service here is wonderful. I have been coming to this place for almost five years twice a year on my husband and I's vacations. He had known the guys that work there and own it for some time before...

Small intimate family run restaurant with outside patio. Great welcome, friendly barman, varied menu, we selected Chicken Riccio and Petit Fillet, served with roast potatoes and vegetables, both meals were good sized portions. Reese was an excellent waitress. We will certainly return.

My wife and I were in Palm Springs for a few days on our way to Scottsdale. We did a "Palm Springs Mod Squad" Desert-modernism tour to start our first morning in the city. At the end of the tour, the guide gave us coupons for free sangria at El Jefe, in The Saguaro Hotel were we met to go...

Had dinner here 2 nights of my recent trip to PS. On Tuesday they have a great Taco Tuesday event with many specials on tacos and margaritas. The Paladino margarita was fabulous and the fish taco was excellent. Great bar vibe and yet still comfortable for families with kids.

We enjoyed a variety of their tasty eats poolside at the Saguaro! Great burger, spiced fries and amazing meat nachos! Would recommend this spot to friends and will continue to enjoy the food during our stay! Waiting for my burger right now!

When we walked in we were told their inventory was low. The first 3 Tequilas requested by our group were out of stock, if you are advertising as a Tequila Bar you should have your stock up to snuff.

I had fish tacos. The presentation was lovely and the tacos were delicious. To go with the tacos, a really good margarita. I can't remember the name but it was made with grapefruit juice. Service was good. All in all, really good.

cute little bar at the Sanguaro hotel serving small bites and plenty of tequila. love the eclectic decor!!

We were going to eat Italian food this night and decided to see if Tinto Tapas restaurant located in the Saguaro Hotel was open. Unfortunately or otherwise it was closed unit Thursday.

Excellent food, excellent staff...a huge disconnect between the hotel staff and the restaurant staff, which was unfortunate.

Love it! Build your own food be it burrito or pizza is always good. The plus that they avoid GMO produced vegetables is a huge for me. And protein minus the bovine injections is another huge plus.

FRESH ingredients , excellent service (and fast), very clean restaurant make this a very attractive choice for HEALTHY fast food. Love all the funky sayings on the napkins and brown paper bags.

The people were not as nice as I am accustomed to for a Chipotle. The food was good, but the portions seemed much smaller than I am used to from them. My bowl was very skimpy and I was actually able to finish it all and want more. That almost never happens.

This Chipotle is a busy yet fast location on a busy Street in Palm Springs. Open late and always seems to be busy.

I have been to this location a few times and they always seem to be low on something whether it's rice or fajitas. I do not eat meat but I have heard them always asking for more chicken. The staff is pleasant and professional.

Same as all Chipotle. Food is fresh, reasonably priced, quick, yet not "fast food". We were in a hurry to catch a tour bus, had limited time, but wanted something besides a drive through. Chipotle was perfect for our needs.

Great fast food and service excellent - very friendly and welcoming. Kids loved it too! Excellent vallue for money.

The Barbacoa is the best. Fresh food fast. Good service and sensible prices. Love Chipotle and Chipotle Palm Springs is as good as any other Southern California Chipotle.

OK, it seems nice and clean, but there was a long hair in my dinner, and it sure wasn't mine.
I won't be back.

We/I eat here several times a month. Enjoying all day meals and deserts. This Denny's is ALWAYS clean (even the menus) with a friendly helpful staff. They make you feel welcome. Service is always quick & efficient, but not rushed. There's never a problem getting a substitution.
If there is a problem with anything they will correct it without hesitation.

Always a delight for breakfast! The wait was short ...very clean and the staff was excellent at all times.

Great food at a fair price. Love the place, and always find great service at Denny's across the country.

My family of 5 had breakfast at iHOP on Feb 10, 2016. Great meal. Way more food than we could eat and teh service was great.

Ihop in Palm Springs is an excellent breakfast and lunch place. I've never had a bad meal there. The turnover in customers is quick and efficient, great customer service. If you go in high season you will have to wait but it is an excellent with an good value for your money.

I planned it well, after reading many reviews. If you want to hike then go early. We went for the views at sunset and they were gorgeous. We waited until the lights came on in the city before going back down. Yes, it was colder up there but it felt wonderful after being in the hot desert.

Tasteless and overpriced...I've had much better food at corner convenience stores. Eat before you go up the mountain.

Bring warm clothing as it is chilly up there even when 114 back in town. Views worth breath taking but it was quite windy as well. Also bring good walking shoes and plan to arrive early for a hike off the beaten path.
